column4: Primary water source storing Han River water. Multi-purpose reservoir for water supply (13 billion m³/year), flood control, and hydroelectric power. Dam raised 2005-2009.

column2:
Taocha Canal Head Works
陶岔渠首枢纽
column4: Controls water entry from Danjiangkou Reservoir into main conveyance canal. Starting point of the 1,267 km gravity-fed central route.

column2:
Yellow River Crossing Tunnel
穿黄工程
column4: Canal crosses underneath Yellow River via 4.25 km twin tunnels. Maximum depth 35 m below riverbed, capacity 280 m³/s.

column2:
Zhengzhou Distribution Hub
郑州分水口
column4: Key distribution point serving Henan’s capital Zhengzhou. One of 39 major diversion gates in Henan province.

column2:
Xuchang Control Center
许昌调度中心
column4: Geographical center of water distribution in Henan section. Houses major automated control gates.

column2:
Jiaozuo Urban Canal Section
焦作城区段
column4: Unique open canal running through downtown Jiaozuo, forming a 10-km green corridor. Supplies >430 million m³/year to the city.

column2:
Anyang River Crossings
安阳渡槽
column4: Large aqueduct and tunnel complex crossing the Zhanghe and Tang Rivers in northern Henan.

column2:
Shijiazhuang Water Terminal
石家庄终端
column4: Primary supply point for Hebei province capital. Benefits >5 million people and eliminated high-fluoride groundwater use.

column2:
Beijing Terminal – Tuancheng Lake
北京团城湖调节池
column4: Final above-ground receiving point for Beijing. Supplies >70% of the city’s urban tap water via 75 km of buried pipelines.

column2:
Tianjin Terminal
天津外环河出口闸
column4: End point of the 154 km eastern branch line. Main water source for Tianjin municipality.
